intro: Pimelea cernua, commonly known as the drooping mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, often drooping stems. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Pimelea cernua typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. It is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is well suited to coastal and dry environments.
